poem:
**Council Walls**

In the shade of brick and dreams,  
a home is more than a key—  
it is roots unfurling,  
a plot of earth to call your own,  
while promises drift like clouds,  
and ministers ponder lock and hold,  
to keep the hearth a hearth,  
a street a story,  
beneath the ever-turning trees.
